chart.loss_tips: Packet loss rate calculation algorithms are inaccurate; please use with caution. Vol(volatility): The tail fluctuation of latency, the higher the value, the greater the fluctuation, calculation method: (P99-P50)/P50.
chart.cutPeak_tips:
Tips on Data Smoothing

When you enable smoothing, the curves you see in the statistical charts are processed using the Exponentially Weighted Moving Average (EWMA) algorithm, a commonly used data smoothing technique.


It's important to note that the values displayed by the EWMA algorithm's smoothed curves, are not the original, raw measured data. They represent a smoothed trend line calculated based on the EWMA algorithm, designed to reduce data fluctuations and make data patterns and trends easier to identify.


Therefore, the values you see are more of a visual presentation, helping you better understand the overall direction and long-term trends of the data, rather than the precise true value at each point in time. If you need to view specific, raw data points, please refer to the unsmoothed data view.

To specify a color, add <color> to the end of the label, e.g. 1Gbps<green>.
A list of available colors can be found at

offline.tips:
To prevent frequent notifications, we use a grace period:
Grace Period: If a client goes offline and doesn't reconnect within this time, an offline notification will be sent.
offline.title: Offline
offline.grace_period_tip: A grace period of less than 45 seconds may not trigger online notifications in time.
